metadata.titel_preek: The Surge of Dangerous, Restless Power

locutie.beschrijving: The sermon describes the contrast between a 'frozen' world and the 'restless power' of God manifested in the healing of the lame man and the resurrection of Jesus.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong narrative flow; focuses on the socio-political and ontological implications of the Acts narrative rather than technical word studies.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of a new power and occasionally announces/promises its availability to the hearer.
voorbeelden: This power, I announce to you, is unloosed in the world.
The God of the Bible is an inscrutable power for life.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from complacency or despair into a state of 'dazzled' hope and participation in God's newness.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; mentions Peter being 'filled with the spirit' but doesn't explicitly invoke the Spirit's current work in the preaching act.

voorbeelden: The world believes all the assets are frozen.
Israel has this very old song.
The resurrection is not just about a dead man.
Consider Easter in the failed places.
Think of us; think of you.
We do not want our tea party upset.
Energy is given in the world for your newness.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are present but often framed as general availability rather than direct divine binding.

voorbeelden: This power, I announce to you, is unloosed.
Our old habits of deathliness now are emptied of authority.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High rhetorical authority, but leans toward announcing a state of affairs rather than performing a sacramental change (e.g., absolution).

indicatoren: Extensive description of 'the world' and 'the authorities'.
Third-person narrative retelling of Acts 3 and 4.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a powerful theory rather than a participant in a current event.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong when present, but often buried in descriptive paragraphs.
voorbeelden: Energy is given in the world for your newness.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used to apply the 'power' to the hearer's failed places.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical/sociological distance before the application.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Describing how 'the world' works and how 'God' works generally.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'I announce' and 'It is given' moments.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids pure moralism (Directive) by grounding everything in God's power.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (God's power in Acts) to a Declarative (It is unloosed) to a Commissive (It is for you).
voorbeelden: This power... is unloosed. It is given to you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but the Assertive phase is disproportionately long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Our old habits... are emptied of authority... No more frightened hearts.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a powerful testimony to God's alternative reality, but it functions more as a 'worldview shift' than a 'sacramental encounter'.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God is a God of odd, dangerous, surging power.
sterke_punten.effect: Breaks the hearer's sense of a closed, deterministic world.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The whole section II (1, 2, 3, 4) is a retelling of the text.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The 'event' is delayed by lengthy reporting.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'I announce to you' moment creates a genuine illocutionary event, but it is surrounded by much 'talking about'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: It lacks the explicit 'In the name of Jesus, I say to you...' which would mirror the performative act of Peter in the text.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the verbs, but the preacher acts as a herald of a fact rather than the mouth of God.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Moderate; the 'I announce' shows a sense of mandate.
tekstueel_bewijs: This power, I announce to you, is unloosed.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the context of Peter.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'surging power' itself.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon is treated as a 'generous offer', which aligns with a means of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: A surging of power that touches all of life.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertive). It needs more 'I [God] give' and 'I [Preacher] release' (Commissive/Declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The resurrection... announces that our control of reality is no longer adequate.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of the Risen Christ, I declare that your control is over; God has taken charge of your life.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a specific life-altering act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'available' rather than 'bestowed'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more direct 'I' to 'You' language in the name of Christ.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who are in despair, Christ promises today: you will not stay this way.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Collapse the distance between the 'they' in Acts and the 'you' in the pews earlier in the sermon.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones annoyed by this newness.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good; the imperatives are well-grounded.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current grounding but make the indicative more performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A rhetorically brilliant sermon that successfully challenges worldviews. To reach 'Sacramental' status, it needs to spend less time describing the power and more time 'unloosing' it through direct, authoritative address.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or the 'appeal' to the listener; SAT focuses on the objective 'change in reality' the words themselves attempt to effect.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric looks at the beauty of the 'frozen assets' metaphor; SAT looks at whether the sentence 'It is given to you' actually functions as a legal transfer of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the 'dangerous' language, the sermon remains largely 'informative' (Assertive) until the very end.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: This power, I announce to you, is unloosed in the world.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the 'event' moment where the sermon shifts from lecture to proclamation.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of Brueggemann's style: high-level assertive 'world-making' that relies on the hearer's imagination to complete the perlocutionary act.
